I debated on whether or not to use some water/humid environment rated Command (a registered trademark of 3M) adhesive strips from 3M but decided to go ahead with the manufacturer&#x27;s recommendations. Then you slide it back on the frame, lather up and shave. The opening at the top of the mirror where the water goes in is wide enough to hold your razor as well when not in use. There is also a platform under the mirror that you could lay your razor upon, and beneath the platform is a place to hold the squeegee that you can also easily slide the squeegee in and out of without problem. The squeegee is the exact width of the mirror, so one downward wipe does the job.  The mirror repels the water so it only beads up on it. I never need to squeegee it while shaving, I only do it after I am done shaving.  No water spot stains on the mirror after over a week of usage.  The mirror frame is held onto the shower wall via adhesive which is included along with the double stick tape, and the back of the frame is clearly marked so you see exactly where to apply both the mounting tape and the adhesive.  It takes twelve hours before the frame is secured and adhesive set before you can put the mirror up on the frame. Let it dry for the twelve hour period it requires and then slide the mirror on to the frame, and you are all set.  I really like it. I had a suction cup mounted fog-less mirror that fell down nearly daily with an alarming crash before buying this one. It also fogged up. I hated having my razor and razorblades chip from falling down with the dang thing. That is no longer a worry. I am very pleased thus far.
